meanings.definition: The quality or state of being precocious.
meanings.sent1: Her precocities were evident from a young age, as she excelled in school and sports.
meanings.sent2: His precocities were remarkable, as he started reading at the age of three.
meanings.sent3: The precocities of the little girl amazed her teachers, who were surprised by her advanced knowledge.
meanings.sent4: The precocities of the young musician were compared to those of a seasoned professional.
meanings.sent5: The precocities of the child prodigy left the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of showing early development or maturity.
meanings.sent1: The precocities of the plant allowed it to bloom earlier than the others in the garden.
meanings.sent2: His academic precocities were evident when he skipped a grade in elementary school.
meanings.sent3: The precocities of the puppy made it stand out among its littermates.
meanings.sent4: The precocities of the young athlete were compared to those of an experienced professional.
meanings.sent5: The precocities of the child actor impressed the casting directors.
